item.title: Mathematical Proofs
item.description: Resources: Mathematical proofs - a transition to advanced mathematics started: somewhere in the first week of July 2022, Switzerland trip. One small pitfall: I skipped a lot of exercices that were a lot of work or lengthy. Not smart. Slides: https://media.pearsoncmg.com/cmg/pmmg_mml_shared/Chartrand_4e/ Sets subset A set \(A\) is called a subset of a set \(B\) if every element of \(A\) also belongs to \(B\). Notation: \(A \subseteq B\) proper subset A set \(A\) is a proper subset of a set \(B\) if \(A \subseteq B\) but \(A \neq B\).
